text: Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piana ladna spora sniezno-biala i niebywale trwala. Kolor jasno pomaranczowy, mglisty z srednia iloscia osadu. Zapach drozdzowy. W smaku pigwa i chlebek wieloziarnisty. Delikatne, dosc tresciwe skromnie z goryczka. w miare OK
Pours pale yellow with a soapy white head and some good lacing. Aroma of cereal and lemongrass. Lemon grass flavor with some grain. Excellent mouthfeel. Really liked this one.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A golden yellow-orange beer with a medium white head ; average retention. Cereal, herbal note. Light dry bitter refreshing, sweet note. Light body, thin texture, average to soft carbonation, sweet dry refreshing finish. Overall, deceiving ; very drinkable.
33cl bottle. As a fan of the Weihenstephan brewery I might be a bit prejudice, but I honestly liked this one! I prefer a good Kellerbier instead of a pilsener anytime!

Med risk för att svära i kyrkan, och bajsa i kollekten, men det här bryggeriet får vara hur anrikt det vill, och slå sig för bröstet över det tills de drabbas av lungmos (som enligt påhittad uppgift passar utmärkt till det här ölet), det är likväl inget jag tänker böja knä inför och avnjuta som om det vore tappat från Guds son. Om det här klosterbryggeriet har varit i drift i ett millennium har de i så fall supit bort erfarenheten eller, mer troligt, haft svårt att tyda den konstlade skrivstilen hos den medeltidsmunk som är alla hembrännares skyddshelgon.
At the beer garden in WhS. Very nice clean Nobel aroma. Taste is slightly sweet, very clean bitterness, great balance and drink ability. I cant have just one. Slight haze but great head.

Nettes, süffiges Kellerbierchen mit Anleihen an Karamell, Zwieback und Butter. Zwischendrin leicht würzig mit etwas an Gras und leicht im Getreide. Mildwürziger Abgang mit spritzigem Unterton und einer milden Malzigkeit. Nicht schlecht.

appearance: cloudy light yellow, frothy bright white head, some lacing.  aroma: cracker, white bread, pie crust, pepper, light corn.  taste: 	toasted white bread, hint of corn, light banana, some lemongrass and pepper.  finish: clean, crisp, lingering hint of hefeweizen and pilsner.  notes: 	One of my favorite styles, done perfectly well. Very drinkable.  Bottle courtesy of Zoltan.
Orange with a medium white head. Aroma is bread, biscuit, honey, caramel, herbal notes. Taste is biscuit, honey, bread, herbs. Bittersweet aftertaste.

Bottle. BBD 17/2/2017. Slightly hazy yellow with white head. The aroma has notes of ripe fruits, some graininess and olives. Bitter flavor, slightly sour with notes of black pepper, grains, lemon and olives. Medium-bodied. Not so fresh but still nice.

Aroma: flowers and malty, honey.
Appearance: clear golden color and white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, flowers, herbal notes, nicely balanced, dry.
Palate: low body and high carbonation.
Overall: Nice kellerbier, complex taste and quite drinkable.

Bottle, BBD 02/17. Thanks rayaron. Hazy orange with a small dense head. Aroma of malt, bread, biscuits, dough. Moderately sweet, yeasty, grainy, honey, bread, a bit vegetal. Medium bodied, smooth. Not bad but probably better when fresh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one is super. Rich and somewhat complex, but ultimately drinkable. Smooth. Has elements of both a Keller/Pils/lager and Hefe/ale and should satisfy both palates when consuming this brew. I cant wait to get more of this stuff.

33cl bottle pours with a near clear deep gold body that supports a somewhat short lived white head. The aroma offers up floral and spicy hops sweetened up by bready sweet malts with a light grassy hop sensation pulled up upon a good swirl of beer. The taste delivers a pleasing flavor depth and more importantly flavor balance. The sweet malty breadiness bangs up against a pleasing level of bitter Noble grassy, spicy, floral and herbal nuanced hops. Toward the finish the sweet graham cracker breadiness greets you with a mild lager fruity ester note.

(Flasche) Es hat eine etwas dunklere gelbe Farbe, ist leicht trüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich, malzig, mit Honig und blumigen Hopfen. Der Geschmack ist schlank, sonst wie das Aroma. Dazu kommt ein fast grüner Abgang mit einer mittleren Bittere.

Poured from bottle. Smells like bread and citrus. Good lookin cloudy gold with thick lacing head. Tasting bread, hops, yeast, citrus, vanilla. Somewhat similar to the Hefeweizen. Great drinkability. Well done.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Best before 17.02.17. Tåkete brunorange med fint skum. Mye karamell i dufte sammen med en del frukt. Det samme i smaken sammen med et lite ufriskt hint av grønnsaker (på grunn av alderen?) Fin fylde og kraftig bitterhet.
330ml bottle. Found notes from a year ago. Clear golden beer with a lasting offwhite one finger head. Malty bready aroma, some grass, some citrus. Similar flavour.

12oz bottle- the pour is a mostly clear pale golden orange with a med off white head. Nice aroma of light fruit, wheat and a light crackery malt. Similar flavors as the aroma...balanced, soft and flavorful.

Has a very rich and malty aroma, with just a touch of fruitiness and citrus hops. Has a very bright flavor. Balanced on the hoppy side, but still nice and malty. Finishes very hoppy and floral with some citrus peel touches (but given the law of 1516, wont have any, so probably from the hops.) A really nice lager. Might make some converts out of those ale-zealots. Very good.

Bottle at home. Clear gold with a white head. Aroma of malt and hay, some crackers. Bitter taste at first, then sweetness - a little bit of apple juice. Medium body, balanced carbonation, faint sweet finish.
Bottle from Total Wine in Daytona. Slightly hazy light gold pour with a white head. Grain, earthy hops. Hint of skunk.
Bottle. Deep golden with one finger head. Grain and citrus. Light bread. Smooth with light hops in the finish. Quite tasty, but very German.

33cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 04-01-2017.
BBD: 03-02-2017.
In short: sweet malty beer.
Pours hazy deep gold.orange with frothy white head. Moderate head retention, some good lacing. Grassy, malty, honey nose. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is grainy sweet, malty, some caramel, some buttery, diacetyls.

Sweet grain and cereal malts, bread, molasses, biscuit. Hazy gold, medium, frothy, white head. Medium sweet. More sweet grain and bread malt, molasses, biscuit, caramel, medium carbonation, medium bodied, more, slightly bitter malts in the finish. Nice Kellerbier, well-balanced, rich in malts. Bottle from BrewDog, Shepherds Bush.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 Poured a clouded gold from bottle. Yeasty earthy aroma and taste. Sweet malts. Not bad

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks troubles. Hazy golden with a white head. Grainy aroma with malt, bread, some lager yeast. Sweetish flavor with graininess, bread, some lager yeast, and a slightly bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.
At Maxs place, Pours yellow hazy with a small head, aroma of corn, malt, yeasty, flavor is bitter with caramel, yeast, malt, cookies, medium bodied

BKL2016. 
Dry metallic yeast aroma, a hint rotten apple core 
Cloudy orange, offwhite head. 
Metallic hops on a straw malt base, a hint yeasty fruit, light, uninspiring 
Unfortunately it embodies the spirit of the Reinheitgebot as you get it from the big German Brewers: Bland, boring, catering to the lowest denominator.

Hazy orange amber coloured beer with a white, frothy, medium sized, quite good lasting head. Aroma is very hoppy, grassy and citrus hops, nice resin and orange, light cardboard, light honey, hay, buiscuit, grain. Taste is perfectly balanced between the caramel malt, pale malt in the background and the hops, light to medium sweet with light bitterness towards a light bitter finish. Medium body, creamy texture, good amount of carbonation. A blast, not only for its style. Easy to drink and still a lot of character.

12 Ounce bottle. Faint citrus smell with raw dough aroma. Cloudy golden in color. Kind of hazy. Taste yeasty, dont taste alcohol or much carbonation. Smooth on palate. Taste rustic like beer that they would have made in 1516.
Pinceszagú kerek és finom kis kellerféle, csak egy baj van vele: hamar elfogy.
Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts fine malty, dry, light bitter background. Spicy hints. Modest grasy. Finish well balanced, soft-malty, still dry background. Nice.

Alaranjado de leve turbidez, espuma branca de média formação e pouca persistência. Aroma típico de maltes de baixa torrefação, leve caramelo, sucrilhos. Corpo e carbonatação leves. Final de pouca persistência, mantém bem o malte, desce fácil, não tem destaques nem complexidade, mas serve para dias descompromissados.

translucent orange with white head. medium-light body with moderate carbonation.

aroma: doughy pilsner malt, citrus and floral hops with a notable bitterness, kettle-caramelization-type melanoidin character.

taste: sweet bready pilsner malt, citrus herbal hops, rich caramel notes.

Aroma; meadow, bread, grass, caramel. Look; near clear pale golden body, off white head. Taste; pale malts, caramel note, mild orange note, grass, bread - leading to a malted mild finish. Feel; normal. Overall; easy. 330mL bottle from Whole Foods Charlottesville, 6/8/16. Hazy orange, thin fizzy white head, decent retention. Aroma of toasted malts. The taste is toasted malt and a bit of citrus. Medium bodied, crisp. Simple but well executed.

Hazy gold with bubbles and a fat and foamy white head. Wonderful aroma of bready German malts. Taste is lively - straw and slightly slow slightly sweet yeast. Bitter close and dry finish. Classic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas of cereal grains, caramel,and orange zest. Taste is toasted wheat and doughy cereal malts, toffee/caramel, slight orange zest and lemongrass in the finish and after taste.
Boa formação e estabilidade de espuma. Notas de cereais, Malte e pão. Cerveja leve e refrescante

Great stuff, this pours a slightly hazy golden with lasting, clingy skim of white foam. Aroma has a mix of grass, lemon, lots of bread and grain. Flavor is similar, but with the grains and breadiness taking even greater control. Finish is semisweet, with the slightest lingering bitterness to the aftertaste. Absolutely delicious, too drinkable. Another great brew from a top notch brewery.

Frisk, brödig men inte så stor doft. Vaxinslag.
Svagt disig brygd, Ljus bärnsten och ett tätt, mycket bra skum.
Härligt maltig, brödig karaktär. En utmärkt, ren, frisk källaröl.
Eftersmaken är kort och beskan är överhuvud taget mycket låg.

330ml bottle (Alko Arkadia, Helsinki)
Very malty aroma, pure light grains, sweet. Sweet grainy malty taste too. Very simple, clean and delicious, maybe a bit sweet. Clean easy drinker, on the sweet side, but I love those pale lager malts. Finish has a gentle bitterness.
Bottle (shared by fatphil, thanks). Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is grainy, malty. Flavor is sweet and bitter, carrots, grains, malt. Overall: good.

330ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Slightly hazy golden color. Herbal hops, grainy, yeasty, dry paper in aroma. Sweet, grainy, straw and hay in taste. Crips palate. Grainy, sweet and grassy hops in aftertaste. Bit slick mouthfeel. Quite solid brew.

330ml bottle from Brewdog, drunk at home in Richmond. As Weihenstephaner 1516 Kellerbier Unfiltered, 5.6%, BB Feb 2017, special edition for 500th anniversary of the Reinheitsgebot. Vibrant orange, sparkling, hazy, big foamy dense white head. Looks great. Aroma is citrussy, damp card, musty grains, sawdust. Body is light, tingly carbonation, quite smooth. Taste is refreshing and crisp, rounded malts, almost an oily vibe, grains. Finishes crisp with a long finish. So well judged and drinkable. Great.
From a bottle at Dominion Wine and Beer. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Aroma of peach and bread dough. Flavor of toast. Crisp, clean finish.

$2.29 bottle from MSWS, Downtown. Pours slightly hazy gold with a good-sized white head. Aroma is nothing special: grains, grass, meh. Taste is grassy, grainy, doughy. Absolutely nothing special to me... yet I see this is a top 50 in its style. Guess I dont like the style.

Orange amber color with a quick fizzy head. Malt and grain aroma with a spicy honey sweetness Flavor is sweet doughy malt and spicy floral hops. Medium bodied with a sweet, spicy finish and light carbonation. A very nice beer

Airy, yeasty aroma with toasted malt notes. Very slightly hazy golden yellow with a small, foamy white head. Soft, bready malt flavor with a subtle, flowery hop bitterness that balances nicely. A little yeastiness curls around the sides of the tongue and adds a nice light sourness. Medium bodied and very drinkable. Finishes light with a lasting malt and yeast flavor. At first this seemed kind of bland, but as I drank more it got better and better. I hope Weihenstephaner will consider making this on a regular (or at least annual) basis.

Color oro claro, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de un dedo de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación media. Aroma a malta y algo herbáceo. Sabor maltoso, con presencia del lúpulo a través del amargor final. Más que decente, aunque no es mi estilo de cerveza.

On tap at Red Cow North Loop. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces slightly. Aroma has lots of straw and and grains with a bit of crisp grass underlying. Flavor has a bit more grass with a nice straw and grain combination that has a touch of sweetness.

0.33 l bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Appearance is obviously cloudy, colour is golden and head was there too. Taste is strong on malts, somewhat dry, and bitter hops. To tell the truth - I expected more from a jubileum beer.
Pours golden with a white head. Aromas of hops. Taste hoppy with a good bitter finish. Light palate.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a thick foamy white head. Aroma of bread, grains and grass. Flavor was smooth and clean with bread dough, grass, toasted grain and had some notes of herbs.

A light easy golden pour topped by a fizzy white head. Light lemon a bit tart, and and malt notes. Flavor is grassy, toasted dough malt, a bit tangy. Solid. I was hoping for more but that isnt this beers fault.

Where and how:  VB festival (sampled as Keller Kolsch (sic!)
Aroma: malty nose with mild twiggy hints, slightly tart.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium cap.
Base: hazy amber gold
Palate :  soft textured, chewy with mild carbonation.
Taste: easy going, mild with soft textures, A bit creamy at finish. Late hint of hops on top.

0,33l bottle. Hazy golden colour with medium lasting big creamy white head. Aroma: Grassy with citrus notes, caramel by time some cheese and banana (yeast) comes to my nose. Taste: Has a sweet malty start with a light sour tone and a soft bitter mouthfeel. A bit salty. Light body with average carbonation. Medium lasting sour/bitter finish. An interesting one. I tasted better keller or zwickel beers that are not in the top50 neither for Germany. Anyway its a good beer.

Bottle. Cloudy orange wiht a low, thick head and prominent bubbles. Nose of peaches and biscuity malt, some orange. Rather simple. Rich malty flavor, bready, very fruity with orange and lots of apricot. Slightly peppery, spicy finish with decent bitterness. OK but a bit disappointing for me. Would like to have it on tap at the brewery.

33cl bottle. Brilliant mostly clear golden yellow color with a lacy white head. The aroma is great, bread dough with earthy hops and a touch of funk. The flavor has a restrained sweetness, honey, bread, and some funky hop notes. Medium light feel, crisp and clean. If youre brewing a kellerbier and you need a benchmark for the style, this is it, dogg. If you dont think this is good, kindly go jump off a cliff because you have no appreciation for real beer.

Malty aroma from a bottle. Cloudy pale. Nice even first impressions with this, just like most other weihys. Another taste is good sizzling co2, yes, not bad. Slight bitter medicine hiding in the background, but you got to look for it. Good stuff for a keller. Yes, decent finish as well.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of malt, bread, grass. Its not overly exciting, yet I found it to be quite good and very drinkable.

Aroma: standard malty/yeasty aroma; nothing remarkable; Appearance: hazy straw colored pour with thin white head; Taste: follows nose; okay; Palate: medium body with medium malty finish; Overall: so-so. Would probably not buy again.
Many thanks to Martin for this beer! Smooth and mild beginning. Sessionable, hints of smooth yeast with nice fresh malt. Sessionable, Nice malt, fresh with a moderate bitter aftertaste. Great brew!

Taste: Crisp, airy, bready, smooth malt, clean finish, with a delicate yeast nose.
Bright gold, semi unfiltered, tall foamy head with a broken lattice of lace. Medium lite body. Good with appetizers.
14-08-16 / 500ml bottle. Clear golden colour whit white head. Medium body, good carbonation. Sligthly bitter notes from the hops. Very smooth.
Half for. Quick note, kind of between an ale and a planet. Very nice dinner drink.
From a bottle. Great example of the style, smooth finish with a touch a of biscuit. Liked it a lot.

A hazy, golden beer, a head is medium and white. Aroma has grain, grass, aromatic and hint of riped fruitness. Taste has grain, grass, and some riped fruitness. Medium bodied, nice carbonation. Nicely and aromatic, grainy, good beer.

A nice light grass aroma..
 Looks fine. This is quite good. A nice flavor that is smooth and consistent, but most importantly it has the right feel - not too thin or heavy. Could definitely repeat buy.

Bottle at Chris and Ruths house after GBBF 2016, Thursday. Clear golden beer with a rich lasting offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, bready, some grass, some citrus. Malty caramel flavor, citrus, bready, slightly spicy, grassy, some biscuits. Solid Kellerbier.

Average frothy white head with good retention.
Clear bright dark yellow colour.
Aroma is malt, honey and sweet flower.
Taste is slight bitterness, malty.
Nice beer, very good.
Kick 030516. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is herbs, malt, fruit. Flavour is herbs, malt, fruit, hay, grass. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

On Tap @ Bräustüberl Weihenstephan 
bread, cereal, herbs, some citrus, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation,

Bottled. From Alko. 
Poured golden, hazy, with a thick white head. 
Hay, earthy notes, white bread and malts. 
Lovely refreshing taste. Slightly doughy, earthy and hay notes. Nice.

Sweet bready malty with some grassy hoppy notes, hay, straw, light banana, some nuances of spice into the close.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. It pours a lightly hazed pale yellow gold color with a nice off white foamy head. The aroma is very fresh and bready. Baked white bread with hints of crust and light lemongrass. Great pale malt character. The flavor is the same. Fresh baked bread and crust with only a light hint of earthy hop bitterness. It has a wonderfully soft, pillowy mouthfeel. Such a pleasant beer. I wish I could crush a lot more of these.

Bottle @ Andys, Munich. Light copper pour with a creamy white head. Slightly hazy. Nose is fairly nuanced. A bit of dirt, grass. Wax and honeycomb. Mellow floral accents. Flavor is well balanced. Light doughy sweetness. Cut grass. Mild lemon bite. Light body, creamy carb. Good.

[2016-07-13] Kullankeltainen, tiheä valkoinen vaahto, hieman samea. Tuoksussa hiivaa ja ohramallasta sekä banaanisuutta. Maku on hiivaisen hedelmäinen, kuivan maltainen ja keskiasteisesti hiilihappoinen. Keskitäyteläinen runko.

L:
-pours a slightly hazy golden-amber with a small to medium,foamy,white head
-medium carbonation visible
-small particle floaties visible
S:
-red apple,tea,sweet grains,honey
T:
-orange,peach,spicy,bready,caram bitterniss for the style
-finishes dry
F:
-medium to high carbonation (overcarbonated)
-light to medium body
O:
Considering the high standards that Weihenstephan has set for themselves, i was really underwhelmed by this.
Faint Aroma with a faint,somewhat fruity taste.
Very mediocre.

Slightly hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, floral and also has a touch of honey. Taste starts slightly sweet with clean malt and honey notes. Finish is more balanced with some floral hops but still has a distinct honey flavor. Medium to light body with medium carbonation. Overall its a nice, ready drinking beer. Feels more like and ale than a kellerbier.
Aus der Flasche in Lichterfelde. Trübes Gold um Glas. Leichte Malzigkeit im Nachtrunk wässrig.

Közepes, tömör, tartós hab, szűretlen, intenzíven gyöngyöző, borostyán szín. Illata enyhe, malátás, némi citrusos beütéssel. Malátás, icipicit édeskés, enyhén kesernyés és gyümölcsös sör, jó összhanggal, közepes szénsavtartalommal. Közepesen testes, kellemes sör.
Flaska köpt i Fresing hos Weihenstephaner, flaska. Inget att lagra. Fin arom och lacing. Välhumlad men har inte åldrats med värdighet.

330ml bottle from BottleDog, Glasgow (£2.50):
An okay beer on the whole but far from impressive & that was doubly disappointing given the fact it was from the Weihenstephan brewery. Overall the beer was definitely drinkable but it seemed quite ordinary & basic really with a faint sweetness & pale malts making up most of the taste alongside the citrus bursts towards the end. Its always nice to try a new beer from the brewery but sadly its not one of their best & I doubt its one Id go back to if it was a regular offering.

330 ml bottle. Honey gold color topped by a moderate rocky white head. Slightly grainy, bready toasted malt nose. Sweet toasted malt flavor upfront. Slightly citrus hop twang. Grassy notes as well. Finishes dry.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 11.2oz bottle. Pours a dark gold with a medium, foamy white head. Very light aroma of malt, hop, grain, grass, and earth.  Initial taste of bread, grass, honey, and malt turns to hop and spice. Mildly bitter finish with a lightly yeasty aftertaste. Well-balanced.  Light body.  Average carbonation.  Crisp mouthfeel.

Bottle from Sprouts: Appeared a beautiful golden honey hue while a thick frothy topping of foam rested on top. Aroma was mild with a deep scent of quality wheat and malts. The beer is well balanced between hop and malt and flavor is subtle, however, the aftertaste finishes harsh with off flavors of dead yeast.

Bottle - moderately hazy gold - nose of honey, grass, bready/doughy character - fairly sweet aroma overall, and the flavor is surprisingly sweet, as well - it is at least a clean sweetness, with sweetbread and honey, followed by light spicy and grassy hop character, light mineral on the tail end - nice frothiness to the texture - decent, but a tad sweet, and certainly less than I was expecting from this brewery.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord. Golden color, slightly cloudy with good foam. Medium/ light aroma intensity; some fruitiness, light malt and citrus. Light/ medium body & complexity. Ok bitterness- good balance. Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden body with a small white head. Nose is straw, pilsener malts, wet grass and hints of nuts, bread dough and mild herbs. Taste is bread dough, pilsener malts, nuts and hints of straw, biscuits and faint red berries. Light body, medium carbonation. Smooth, straightforward Kellerbier from Weihenstephaner; Id expect no less from these guys when it comes to the classic German styles.
Draft. Hazy gold poured with a nice white head. Malty aroma with grass and earthy notes. Nice lacing. Slight bitterness on the backend but mostly balance.
330ml bottle. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Medium carbonation. Grainy, malty, yeasty. Light to medium bitterness and sweetness. Good version of market lagers.
bottle, courtesy of MoritzF! Hazy amber colour, tall white head. Malty start with a shy yeasty backgournd and good aromatic hops, spicy and fruity. Good one.

330 ml bottle. Hazy golden colour, thin white head. Sweetish, bready-malty aroma with grassy hops. The flavour is malty, with grainy and buttery notes, and a moderately bitter grassy finish. Quite nice.

Draught at Frederiksberg Ølbar. Poured in to a Weihenstephaner Weizen glass. Hazy, golden colour with a fluffy, white head. Sweet aroma with grasses, earthy notes, bread and pale malts. Taste is light bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and slightly bitter with bread and grasses. Lovely Kellerbier.
Deep golden with white head. Malty, floral and some caramel. Smooth, spicy and dry finish. Very balanced and well made.
Tap Hazy yellow colour with small head.Aroma is bready and malty with flavor of hops and caramel light body and hoppy finish.
Bottle from Dan Murphys 080716. Clean white head on this beer looks good above the amber beer. Aroma Id mild as is the flavour. Decent enough.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is heavy sweet cracker Pils malt, medium yeast notes and light spicy hops. Flavor is moderate sweet cracker Pils malt, light spicy hops and bitterness, yeasty with a clean lager character and a lightly sweet finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
Bottle 33cl from Alko. Pours slightly hazy golden, small white head. Malty, grassy, hay aroma. Grassy, malty flavour.
Bottle from Julios. Slightly hazy medium golden color. Frothy off-white head. To medium lace. Fruity and malty. Decent spicy hop balance. Long dry bittering finish.

Bottle. Pours light hazy yellow, with a big creamy head. Aroma is roasted malts with cereals, and herbal hops with citrusy notes 
Medium body with a creamy mouth feel, and soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet, roasted malts with cereals, honey and heather, as well as herbal malts with cereals, peppery floral notes and some citrus peel. Lingering herbal bitterness throughout the finish. Impeccably balanced!

Bottle:
Clear gold with a tall, off-white head.
Grain, grassy hop aroma.
Taste is slightly buttery....barley malt....
Nice and rich....good grassy hopping.
Very good.

Bottle tasted at home on the 28/06/2016. Pale golden colour with a big and blond foamy head. Aroma of grain, light malt and fruits. Taste is grainy light and yeasty. Aftertaste is yeasty too. Next one please!
Bottle at cara B. Golden colour with white head. Grain and grass aroma. Slightly sweet, malt, grain, grass, bitter taste. Medium body.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena ja sameana, noin sormen paksuisella vaalealla vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on reilusti jyväistä viljaisuutta, makeampaa hedelmää ja hunajaa sekä olkisuutta. Maku jatkaa vahvaa viljaista maltaisuutta, makeampaa hunajaisuutta sekä raikasta ruohoisuutta, kaikkia melko tasapuolisesti. Hiven saippuaisuuttakin on joukossa. Suutuntuma on melko makea ja raikas, kesäjuomaa parhaimmillaan. Raikas ja puhdas kellerbier, jossa kuitenkin riittävästi makua ollakseen muutakin kuin raikas.
En källaröl helt enkelt! ;-) Hyfsat fruktig och med en bara balans. Lättdrucket.
Bottle - copper color, creamy flat head. Taste is caramell, some fruity hoppiness and malts. Carbonation is very flat. Style quite near to the classic Zoigl I once had. Nice one, highly drinkable.

12 ounce bottles. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. Strong retention. The aroma has floral notes, sweet grainy notes, and moderate fruity levels. Taste is a well balanced approach. The beer stays sweet throughout, but there is always a lingering floral bite of bitterness there to contend with. Medium body, medium carbonation, and soft, prickly carbonation.
Pours a clear yellow color. Malty, full body with flowery hops and a crisp finish.

Pours a finger and a half of head on a hazy straw body.
Aroma is characteristic metallic and hay with a little honey.
Taste has moderate bitterness, gives way to honey sweet. Nice.
Texture is crisp.

Bottle shared by JK - thanks! Light orange in color, slightly hazy, slight white head. Slightly spicy herbal hoppy nose. Nice mouthfeel. Slightly buttery, moving into some herbal hops. Low bitterness. Nice.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Keller bier. Gold color with some haze. Thin, lacing white head. Lots of yeast in the aroma. Dry malt flavor, a mineral character that is very good in this beer. Grassy hops and lots of yeast in the aroma and flavor. Excellent.
Bottle->SA. Pale gold with bare white head. A: grains, hay, barley. T: tons of grains, some earthy malt. Like drinking mild depression. Not a fan.
Pours a clear yellow golden color with white head. Cereal grains, hay, and bread on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with the same cereal grains, crisp and clean.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, fruit, grass, bread.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, grass, some floral notes, grass, caramel, bread.

Tap at Hessen House DSM. Cloudy gold with a fluffy bright white head. Nose of tart apples and flowers. There is also some leather. The taste is sweet with some dough and nuts. Notes of flowers are also present. A decent light brew.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy with a gold color and a large head. Aroma is a musty grain smell with hints of toast. Taste is a slightly bitter up front with just a hint of funky grains. A malty balanced finish.

33 cl. bottle pours foggy orange-peach with a quarter inch of spongy foam on top. Nose is light orange zest, spicy leaf, molasses and bread. Interesting flavors of orange toffee, lightly tart apple with the woody pith, nut bread, mineral and dried grass. Near-medium body has medium carbonation and a nice balance.

A bit hazed golden color with a fine thick white head. Mellow aroma with a decent intensity. Medium body and an average to soft carbonation. Nice bitterness and a mellow sweetness. Herbal/grassy, malty and some wort in the flavor. Decent summer thirst quencher.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]
Golden towards light amber, thick head. Pear and apple aroma, earth tones. Fruit juice taste, balanced bitterness.

Bottle. Nose light lemon and apple, touch dusty with a hint of yeast, but very bright and fresh. Pour clear golden with a hint of orange, very large and oily-rocky beige head (near-Orvallish), lace. Very crisp in the mouth, Medium body, bit of orange peel coming through, extremely juicy malt and noble-ish hop with more citrus than Im used to, really squeezed it out; touch of bread, yeast, grain in the finish, excellent floral touches. Mildly but persistently sweet with a light and clean bitterness, faintly minerally, getting flashbacks to drinking out of Stoneware in Nürnberg. Spicy throughout and theres a hoppy shade of melon/lotion in the aftertaste.  Bold flavor and pretty well captures the spirit of the thing, I imagine it will still be quite good after the hops die back. [2016.06.11: 3.8]

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. A typical, traditional Kellerbier, but not a boring one! Slightly sweet , low bitterness, smooth texture. More malts than hops, and it does well. Highly drinkable despite not being completely dry. A good downer.
330ml bottle at home. Hazy golden colour with a foamy white head. Yeasty, biscuity aroma, taste is earthy malt. Nice

This was poured into a mug.
The appearance was a hazy burnt orange/dark yellow color. Milky colored foaminess coats the sides of the glass in a nice fashion.
The smell takes on sweet bready/biscuit dryness rolling into a crisp sweet fruitiness (almost apricot-like).
The taste copies the smell, pretty much spot on. Grassy sweet/biscuit/bready aftertaste. Crisp wet sweet malty finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a spectacular sessionability about it. Carbonation rides low. Some sticky malts hit, but dont cling, seems like they just slide nicely.
Overall, as a kellerbier, Id say it works. I see its supposed to be top notch for its style, me, I do like it a lot. Definitely again.
On tap. Traditional and unpretentious. Lots of grainy, cereal taste matched with a moderate bitterness. Tastes like a slightly more interesting macro lager.
Hazy golden. Nose is spicy yeast, banana, bready. Taste is very bready, spicy yeast, a bit bitter and dry on the finish.

Clear medium gold pour, just shy of a finger of white head. Nose is medium roasted malt. Leans slightly sweet. Middle is soft caramelized malt with a hint of apple. Finish dries from herbal hops. Nothing flashy, but a solid beer.

From Belmore Beverage. The aroma is biscuit, grassy, noble hop the appearance is slightly hazy Amber, white head. The flavor is biscuity, spicy, noble hops. Medium in body. The finish is spicy, noble hops. Nicely done. Clean, competent example of the style.
Aromas of sweet bread, hay, cereal, subtle grass. Cloudy orange-gold with a fairly lasting white head. A little sweet, bready, earthy. Medium bodied.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with a small creamy white head that leaves lots of sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and floral with sourdough crackers, dough, hay, dried flowers, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is time sweet, bitter, slightly malty and floral. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny dry and light to medium bodied. Finish is bitter with doughy bready malts and floral hops. Clean without losing and flavour. Hugely quaffable and drinkable. Very nice summer beer!
Dimmigt orangefärgat med fin krona. Doftar svagt av hö, lite citrus. Smaken tämligen ren malt, ganska torr, lite beska. Eftersmaken något tunn och kort. Vekare variant av deras Hefe.
Tap at Leijuva Lahna, Helsinki. Colour us slightly cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dryness, straw, some ripe fruits and malts. Nice straw in aroma.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 5/4/2016  330ml bottle BB 27.01.17. Poured a slightly hazy pale amber with a one-to two-finger bright white frothy head that diminished slowly and laced well. Carbonation high and fine to medium. Aroma and taste very similar to draught beer recently tasted. Light body. Smooth, slightly sweet with a mild bitter finish.     4/6/2016  Draught at Catchment Brewing, West End, Brisbane. Poured a clouded pale amber with a one-finger white frothy head that diminished slowly and laced well. Carbonation low and fine to medium. Aroma subtly of malt, slightly sweet citrus and yeast. Taste malty, earthy, hints of burnt malt, hints of spice and with a slight bitterness and initially with an unpleasant tart/acidic after-taste (that eventually subsided). Light body. Smooth, slightly sweet with a mild bitter finish.

Very cloudy, little bit of a skunky taste but not quite skunky like Heineken. Amber yellow color pour. Very traditional  German tasting. A special brew not expected to be a regular.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Half litre bottle, poured into oversized Tripel Karmeliet tulip. A: Almost an orange tint of amber, hazy, decent sized head which stayed around for a bit. S: Straw, orange zest, Saaz hop. T: Followed the nose, strong hints of barley sugar, lingering bitter finish. M: Medium body, not hugely carbonated, fairly smooth. O: One of an increasing number of beers brewed to commemorate the 500th anniversary of the Reinheitsgebot. This emphasized tradition.
Tap. Clear, amber, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.

Bottle from SB Majorna cons 2016-06-01 Göteborg
AR: bready, bread syrup, grass
AP: clear copper, frothy white foam
F: bread, bread syrup, dry grass, wee caramel,

Growler takeout, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy golden with a white head. Bready, grainy malts followed by orange, lemon and lime. Hints of strawberry. Floral and yeasty with herbal notes. Solid bitterness to finish. A pleasant surprise.

Bottled, 330 ml.
Opal deeper golden one with a medium sized creamy snow-white head on it.
Nose brings yeast, hay, florals...
Aroma has bread, hay, florals, mild citrusses and grassy hops, mouthfeel is slick to oily.
Bread-crusty, grassy finish.
Refined, nice.
Draft at Café Berlin. Hazy bright orange body with over an inch of soapy, white head. Bready malts, citrus, lager yeast. Quaffable. Delicious. Light and simple. Uber fresh.

Bottle at BD Brighton. It pours lightly hazy golden wth a thick white head. The aroma is fresh, bready malts, toasted grain, light sweetness, cereal and hay. The taste is smooth, mellow grassy bitterness, hay, bread, toasted grain, straw, floral notes and a touch of spice with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, massaging carbonation. Well - rounded and crazy drinkable. A very nice lager bier.

Draft at bottleworks, because I saw some big thread about how awesome this beer is. Half pint in an adorable handled mini-stein. Clear gold with creamy head that lasts forever. Tastes disappointing, like some honey and corn (over)sweetened adjunct lager (I gather thats not what this is, but thats how it feels to me when I drink it so thats what Im writing. Deal with it.) Light body, okay carbonation. Hard to finish a half pint. I assume theres either (a) something off with this keg, or (b) something off with me tonight, but Im in no hurry to right this wrong.
Pours a goldensih color with a foamy off white head. Good malt backbone with some blue stone and green notes. Nice beer.

Draft at BrewDog Clapham Junction. Looks wise cant go wrong - a hazy golden. Much sweeter than I was expecting but in a good way. Surgary and fruity. Didnt get too much of an aroma but that may just be my nose. Overall a lovely beer.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of grain and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, grain, minerals, and hay, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle pour into tulip glass from Greg & Janes Beer and Wine. Could there have been any more appropriate beer for my 500th review than this 500-year celebration of the Reinheitsgebot? Aroma is subtle fruits, malts, yeast. Appearance is hazy golden yellow with noticeable floaters, little sparkle, finger-width foamy white head with fair retention and nice soapy lacing. Taste is clean cracker/biscuit malt with noble hops. Palate is light bodied with sticky texture, average to lively carbonation and dry finish. Overall, this certainly isnt the most memorable of my first 500 ratings but Im still glad I had it and commemorated a significant event in brewing history.
Pilsnerfärgad lite oklar med stort vit skum. Doftar och smakar spannmål och lite citrus. Fyllig bra pilsner

Bottle from The Beerhive. Hazy golden body with a dense white head. No visible carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of wheat, banana peel and sweet potato. Flavour of creamy pale malt, pear and grass. Medium body with a smooth texture. Soft fizz. Flavoursome and well balanced.

Draft @ Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy weak yeasty aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy finish.

Slightly hazy yellow beer, thin white head, a bit lively. Slightly sour, bready aroma. Tangy fruit in the flavour though thats quite short-lived. Theres still a slightly yeasty quality to the flavour. Bit of hoppy, floral taste to it as well.

330ml brown bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy golden with medium sized frothy off-white head, that reduced quickly. Aroma of , toast, biscuits, honey and cereal. Flavours of biscuits, honey, toast and a hint of herbs. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is light-medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. 1516 Kellerbier is a benchmark for the style, well balanced and flavourful.

500ml bottle at the Weihenstephan brewpub in Freising. Aroma is light oats, light citrus. Cloudy yellow ti golden color with a frothy white foam. Taste is light bitter, light sweet. Dry, soft carbonation. Perfectly balanced. Amazing Kellerbier.

From the 330 ml. bottle. Poured into a footed Pilsener glass it has a straw yellow color leading up to a modest, short-lived white head. Aroma is muted but I pick up toasted brad, toasted crackers, grass, and mild spice. The body is light to medium. The taste has the same toasty characters as the aroma with a more forward grassy hop crispiness to finish.
opalescent golden colour, medium sized dense head; aroma of grains, bread, hay, some floral notes and hints of fruitiness; taste is the same; refreshing beer

Tap. Slightly hazy Orange rust. Yeasty, slight noble hops, savory bread and cracker in the aroma. Flavor is very similar: bready yeast, some earthy notes, savory mineral hop. Still middle of the road for the style, yet well made. Lighter soft body.  Im a sucker for anything that comes close to solid in this style...

Aroma is a mild blend of grain, bread and spice. Color or is a hazy pale orange topped with a healthy white head at least two fingers thick. Bitter grainy taste. Thin bodied. A malty character smooths out the finish.

Bottle code 3056. Pours a hazy gold with a touch of amber. Outstanding head volume, quite outstanding retention and world class lacing.

Light bready nose that has a touch of spice, possibly coriander. Also present in this borderline outstanding nose is a light fruity background, probably pear.

Light medium body that has a light slickness to it. World class carbonation / body balance with a rousing mid-palate effervescent kick and a rollicking finely bubbled prickly finish that showcases the crispness.

The flavor profile is outstanding. Rather intense for the style, rather complex and outstandingly balanced are apt descriptors. Bread, cracker biscuit, subtle caramel, herbal hops and a light fruitiness (pear with a light lemon note) all appear. Bitterness is mild in general, but moderate for the style. This is a refreshingly crisp beer. The finish is a crisp slow fade of the above flavors with a grainy caramel underneath.

Guldgul, disig med fast vitt skum. Brödig doft med inslag av honung och aningen aprikos. Smaken är maltig med lite honungssötma, gräs, hö och lite örter, en fin beska avslutar. En utmärkt kellerbier, smakrik och med bra beska, lättdrucken och läskande.

0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy golden body, thick a nd lasting white head. Aroma of bread, hay, floral hops and some grains. Taste of bread, crackers, hay, yeast and floral hops. Light medium bodied. Balanced and smooth. Very nice kellerbier.
Light bready and malty. Straw notes and very light fruity. Clean and smooth taste from light malts and careful classic hops. Very easy to drink, but a bit anonymous.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Bottle: The aroma consists of light-moderate cereal/grain, mild bread, and grass. It pours a transparent golden-orange with a one finger white head that settles to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. There is some sporadic webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with light-moderate grain and sweet cereal notes. There is some light bready notes in the middle. The finish has light grass and a touch of herbal notes. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.
Keg at Brewdog Manchester; hazy golden amber pour with a bubbly white head, aroma has crisp grain and some floral action, taste has bread dough, sweet potatoes, grain, pleasant.

11.2 ounce bottle - $2.79 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a hazy, golden body with a medium-sized, near white head. Moderate lacing.

Smell: Crackery, grainy, doughy notes tied with a ribbon of sweetness. Slight herbal, grassy and lemony hints.

Taste: A bready grainy taste with a crackery accent and slight golden syrup sweetness. The light graininess continues on, joining the hop additions of lemon, leafy herbs and a bit of earthiness. Finishes fairly crisp with a little lingering breadiness.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Overall: Quite refreshing.
UPDATED: MAY 17, 2016 Bottle. Pours hazy golden, medium white head, good lacing. Aroma is Bready, grains. Flavor follows, light sweet, light gray bitterness, Bready. Medium body. Really good.
330ml bottle. Hazy bright amber body with a medium white head. Light bread, grass, a bit metallic notes, some biscuit. Hint of lemon juice in the background. Quite enjoyable.

Draught at Taphouse.
Clear amber colored with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hops and bread with notes of pine needles.
Malty flavor of hay, hops and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

Keg at BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a clean pale golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is crispy cracker, grass, sweet grains and straw. Taste is also quite sweet grainy upfront, then more crispy dry with grassy crackery straw notes. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, excellent
Bottle from Systembolaget. A bit hazy golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of bread, some citrus and grain. Medium body and bitterness.

330ml bottle into stein. Hazy golden beer which filled the whole stein with its foam. Nose of bread and sweet malt, a bit of pepper. the occasional bubble makes an appearance. Medium body, grainy finish. A little pepper and malty sweetness late on. Nice and solid.

Bottle from VP Aker Brygge enjoyed at home
Light copper, quite hazy, huge frothy inviting beige head. Smell of hay, floral hops, some herbs, hints of green grass and nice light malts. Moderate sweet, fruity malts, hay, hints of honey, quite floral, nice malts and a good touch of hops, moderate bitter, grassy tail. Very enjoyable stuff, great malt and hop balance
Hazy and light tan. Touch of herbal hop. Bubbly head. Fruity, earthy bitterness, creamy body, sweet and bitter. Its a fun brew.

Draught. Golden in color with a whitish head. Nice grainy notes on the nose. Light bitterness, subtle fruityness and some nice notes of cereal in taste. Long lasting grainy finish. Nice and soft too. Very good drinkability.

Pours hazy gold with small white that vanishes in a flash.
Nose is malt, cereal, honey, flowers. They are all present on the palate as well, along with lime, yeast, grass, white grapes and pleasantly spicy heat with white pepper and lemongrass. Floral note continues throughout, balanced by restrained bitterness on the finish.
Medium body with good carbonation. Nice warm weather beer.

Draft. Hazy deep golden body. Off-white head. Aroma of toasted grain (hint of raw), hay, dough, lemon, herbs. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/velvety texture, soft carbonation. Bready taste along with grass and grain notes.

Halvljus och lätt grumlig. Söt doft och smak med bröd och hö. Lätt i tonen och slinker ner lätt. Trevlig

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Citrusy, crispy and malty, fresh. Dry finish
Bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy golden with frothy white head. Malty, bready aroma with some floral notes, light citrus, cereal. Same in taste with some sweetish honey notes in the finish.

16oz pour in The Priority Public House, Encinitas on 6th May 2016. Hazy golden yellow body, short lifed white head. Nice even blend of bready maltiness and floral hops in both the nose and taste. Refreshing and thirst quenching with enough flavour to keep me interested until the final gulp. Another fine beer from these guys, strange how I came across it in Southern California and not in Germany.

Rated on 5-06-2016 at Teds Wine Bar, Fort Wayne, IN. (Bottle) The appearance is a small white head with a short retention, golden body, no carbonation observed, and spotty lacing. The aroma is hops, grassy, herbal, light spice, bready, and caramel malt. The flavor presents moderate bitterness, hops, earthy, bready, herbal, caramel malt, and a dry finish. The mouthfeel is light carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. A quaffable beer that is worth trying.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours hazy yellow gold with a thin white head. Aromas of pale malt. Taste is light yeast, ovaltine. Malty sweet finish.

On keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. 
Appearance - cloudy golden with a decent head. 
Nose - majorly malt. Cereal and light lemon. 
Taste - more citrus coming through but basically malt dominant.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - drinks well but unexciting.

(draught) hazy golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of fresh wort and floral hops, with lots of honey-tinged pale malts, cornflakes and yeast slurry. flavour is mostly the same, lots of wort, floral hops and cornflakes, with some notes of dandelions, more honey and a light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Aroma: Honey, bread, cookies, spice, caramel, molasses. Appearance: body is golden, head is dense, pretty high. Taste: sweet, cooky, honey, light spicy hoppiness, no bitterness, malty, bready. Palate: Carbonation is low, body is medium-high, finish is sweet.

Bottle at home. Clear light orange colour with a small white head. Nose is malty, clear but nothing outstanding. Taste is light sweetness light bitterness. Not an outstanding brew, but definitely very well balanced, crisp and refereshing.

330 ml bottle. Hazy golden body with very active carbonation topped by a fluffy, lasting white head. Aromas are light though grass, flowers, lime and a little spice. Taste starts of with crackery malt before a grassy note kicks in. Hints of lemon and honey at the back end. Clean finish with a light herbaceous aftertaste. Restrained and refined.

Produces up a slightly misty, orange amber with a messy, rocky white crown that holds. A hint of lemongrass peaks out amongst notes of chaff, sawdust, dried grassy herbs, peppery and earthy noble hops and toasted cereal grains. Pretty straight forward on the palate. Cereal-like malt profile shifts into peppery, earthy hops before a lasting bitter bite on the finish. Body is light and the carbonation lively. Overall it is dry, light and balanced with a solid malt and clean hop profile. Certainly not up there with the greatest of kellerbiers. Played pretty safely really! (33cL, BB 27/01/17, Dan Murphys Cannington)

Aroma of sweet malt, oats, nuts, cereal and hay. Pours clear golden-amber liquid with a small white head. Light sweetness and light bitterness with a grainy flavour, lots of malt notes, yeast, fresh oats, barley and some grassy hops. Full body with a smooth texture, very drinkable. I like the natural flavour of this beer, the malt tastes like authentic grains and not just sweet, it also adds a lot of smoothness to the texture.

One of the prettiest beers Ive poured in some time. Saw a great online Weihenstephaner video that advised swirling bottle before pouring to properly release yeasty sediments. Theres a nice hay-influenced aroma, sweet and slightly bitter interplay with the taste, and dry, just a bit peppery finish. A great limited-edition lager worth finding.

On tap at Shamrocks. Poured a hazy golden color with a fair head that fades slowly. Aroma of light fruit, grass bit of yeast and malt. Taste of light fruit with light malt sweetness with bit of grain and spice. nice bitterness and a fairly clean finish. Moderate body, nice crispness with a bit of a texture feel. Nice Kellerbier.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Crispy sweet banana yeast on top of a sweet hay and grassy malt kellerbier. Light but flavorful and satisfying. High carbonation and cool how it carries that classic Weihenstephan yeast taste. I?m very curious to try the helles and pils after this because it?s better than I expected. Even sweet malts with a nice fresh hoppiness to it. Great kellerbier.

Tap @ Hopaholic Budapest.
 Pours golden with a big white head. Smells a bit fruity malty, bread. Tastes fresh bread malty with a clear bitter finish.

This bottled brew from a beer bar poured a small sized head of frothy fine to medium sized white colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind a very softly carbonated transparent light yellow colored body and a poor lacing. The mild aroma was musty. The semi-thick crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a mild Irish red malt aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of semi-sweet mild wheat crisp hops malt and bread dough. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

06.05.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice bubbly-creamy longlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is slightly sweet grainy, weeds, wet hay, minerals, wet grain, paper, sawdust, grass. Taste is dry mineraly, weeds, minerals, paper, dried grain, sawdust, hay, bark, grass, cardboard. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh and watery mouthfeel. Boring.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Hazy deep golden, small head. Grassy spicy nose. Dry with medium body and well rounded, firm mouthfeel. Mildly bready malt surrounded by a balanced dose of floral, grassy hops. Mid bitter finish. Relaxed and pleasant.

(Keg at Punavuoren Ahven, 20160506) The beer poured golden and lightly hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass, grain, fruitiness and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grain, fruitiness, malts, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was grainy and bitter. A well done grainy lager. Tasty.

Tallahassee, Fl - New Leaf Market - Bradfordville - Square Liquors - 330 ml bottle. Pours a slightly murky medium copper with a soft off-white head. Aroma has some brown sugar accents, a hint of molasses. Flavor is sweet and belly warming with some dates, a touch of chocolate, a bit of brown sugar sweetness. Mouthfeel has a nice thick textured feel to it. Not bad at all.

Bottle from Berts
slightly hazy light golden color with a smallish quickly dissipating bubbly white head. Grainy crackery pilsner maltiness with earthy spicy floral hops. I know its weird but I swear I get some tomato juice aromas in the nose. Bready sweet pilsner maltiness in the flavor, with faint earthy hops to barely counter the malt. Decent beer.

Tap at Hilpeä Hauki. Deep golden color, steady small white head, lace. Aroma has grass, some butter and fruityness. Light-bodied. Fruity, crisp, light butterness and citrus. Refreshing. Light metallic notes. Ok.

33cl bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden beer with a nice white head that slowly disappears. Aroma of wort and hay. The taste is excellent, just hoppy enough and with a rich flavour that lingers. Overall great beer.

The body is a clear golden yellow with a long-lasting white head. The beer has a golden yellow color. The foam is white with medium-small bubbles. The foam will slowly disappear, leaving great trails. Smells a little flavored malt, hops and fabulous fruits. Hints of honey, lemon, apricot, light pear and banana. Are little white bread, cloves and some herbs. Slightly spicy malt with thin fine hops. The flavors of sweet lemon, apricot, gentle pears, white bread and some honey arrive. A little spicy with clove in the aftertaste where even lemon show more. The beer is creamy, round and very big for the class. Plump body, medium-low bitterness, medium carbonation. Some juicy with a creamy smoothness. Very well balanced and covers the entire palate. World-class in their class.

May 4, 2016. Bottle, best before February 17, 2017. 
Clear golden with a medium sized dense white head. Aroma is grain, cereal, wort, some floral and herbal notes and hints of minerals. Taste is light sweet, soft bitter. Finish is sweet, grainy, floral with light bitter notes, some minerals. Medium bodied, average, small bubble carbonation.

330ml bottle from DMs. Limited edition release to celebrate the 500th anniversary of the beer purity law in Germany. Probably limited to a few hundred million! Very easy drinking Kellerbier with honey sweet grainy malts on the nose and tongue and a mild grassy hop presence. Clear bright golden appearance with a decent white head that lasts. Not much more to say really - does the job.

Weve come a long way since 1516. Back then, there was war in Syria, skirmishes in Gaza and political feuding in Brussels. Thank God all thats behind us. Meanwhile, in Bavaria they laid down the iron rule that has steered German brewing to this day. This commemorative brew is a clean, malty keller. Someone else described it as liquid bread - I cant improve on that. Its all about the barley malt. Pours a hazy unfiltered gold with low head. Nose is all malt - haybale, bakers dough, perhaps a dash of watery orange juice. Moderate carbonation. Full malty flavours, sweetish with some late bitterness. Quite lovely as a showcase for the malts. (Leura Cellars May 1016)

Pours hazy golden with low white head 
Aromas of hay, bread, hints of citrusy fruits, hints of bananas 
Taste has notes of bananas, hay, hints of bubblegum, bread, herbs 
Medium bodied, quite dry bitter finish, low carbonation
Bottle from SB. Cloudy yellow with a medium creamy white head. Fruity and herbal tones. Fruit, malt, bread and hops. Medium body with a nice malty and fruity finish.

bread, hay, grass, cheese, basement aromas, cooked vegetables, hazy, amber, golden, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, salty, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter,
Draft at Prost!-Boise. Hazy golden body with huge fluffy head. Malt sweetness abounds in aroma and taste. Creamy, velvety feel, small bitter bite at the end. Another classic.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, jord, honung, korn, bröd med toner av örter och gräs. Lagom sötma, rund och len, fruktig och fin beska, bra balans. Gott!

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2016 From XXXII. In Teku glass. Snack with Agu, with acorn-feed iberian ham and sheep cheese. Maybe not the most amazing taste but really enjoyable in long sips in all situations. Truly drinkable. Avg: 3.77

3 Sep 2016: From 32GP. In Teku glass. After dinner. Feels more fruity, spicy and tasty than the last time. I could have it everyday. Very refreshing and drinkable

Grass, straw, herbal, bread, minerals.
Hazy amber colour, medium white head, lacing.
Mid-sweet, soft/medium bite, lightly salty.
Medium body, average carbonation, bitter and grainy finish.
Enjoyable.
@ Havregatan 20160501. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Yeasty and grassy with hay, herbs and honey notes, medium sweet, light to medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and grassy.

Flaska från SB. Aningen disig gyllengul vätska med medelhögt vitt skum. Fin doft av nybakat bröd, jäst, säd, hö, gräs, blommor. Mjuk, rund, len, rejäl kropp med en riktigt fin smakbild. Lätt sötma med maltiga smaker, aningen blommig honung som balanseras riktigt bra av gräs, hö och örter med exakt lagom beska. Smakerna är fint integrerade och skapar en nyanserad och komplex smakbild. Kanske saknas lite karaktär från jästen om man ska vara petig men helt klart en riktigt bra kellerbier.
Cool that it is inspired by a 500 year tradition (or law rather). The flavor is good enough.

Bottle. Lemon, barley malt, and dry hay aroma. Hazy golden yellow with giant eggshell white head. Moderately sweet light lemon, barley malt, and moderately bitter hay/quinine flavor. Good body.  Hops a bit harsh especially for the style.  Sad that this is a limited edition - I was hoping it was going to be a regular.

Pour is a murky orange with a large white head. Aroma is a nice dark bread malt with some sweet toffee and someting earthy but sweet like a candied yam. Flavor is an overabundance of bread with some dark fruit marmalade. Now this is a beer where you can say that this is like drinking liquid bread. The malt here is so clean and chewy. My kellerbier experiences are few and far between but Im going to pick up a six pack of this before it dissappears.
330ml Bottle - Hazy gold/light amber with a small head. Floral, hoppy, moderately sweet and slightly earthy taste with peach, sultanas and earthy notes standing out.

Lys brun lett tåkete med to fingre høyt tykt hvitt skum. Lukter, hvete, karamell, tørket frukt mot aprikos og noe smør. Smaker søtlig maltekstrakt, tørket frukt og rista brød. En middels bitterhet kommer også. Maltsødmen sitter lenge.
Bottled. Pours golden with a big white head. Smells a bit fruity malty, bread. Tastes fresh bread malty with a clear bitter finish.
Overall: Wheat bread, banana, apple peel.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2016-04-29.

Lätt dimmig, gyllene halm gul, lätt gulaktigt skum. Doft: Malt, bröd, jäst, övermogna citrusfrukter, fräsch höstluft. Smak: Malt, fruktbröd, lätt av övermogna citrusfrukter, jäst, jord. Fräsch maltig öl.

Pours a hazy dark gold with thick white head. A malty and grain aroma. A very similar taste, but very powerful, with grains, malts, and some wheat, yeast and citrus. A very strong tasting beer with a lingering dry grain and sweet lemon aftertaste.
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear golden, medium white head. Grainy malt aroma, herbal hops, some notes of cardboard. Dry, medium bitterness.

Clear, pale golden, medium+ white frothy head, nice lacing, good lasting. Aroma is of malt, light grains, honey, buttery, bit flowery and herbal. Taste is medium sweet malt, grain, honey, medium flowery and herbal hops, medium bitterness, buttery, light yeasty breadiness. Medium- bodied, average carbonation. Quite bitter for a Kellerbier.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget, Hornstull. Hazy pale golden, dense medium size white head leaving good lacing. Malty aroma, bread, biscuits and some earthy notes. Crisp and clean mouthfeel. Malty sweet taste in the beginning, biscuits, bread and honey, a bit herbal in the background and a grassy and mild floral finish.

330 ml bottle.

Bright golden color, some head. Taste is "fresh" like normal weihenstephaner hefe.
Aroma is Weihenstephan yeast, German hops/malts and a hint of band-aid/honey. The flavor is German hops/malts, light fruit and a dryish/honey finish.

330 mL bottle. Slightly hazy, bright orange, with a medium, bubbly, white head. The nose is bread dough, bubblegum, cinnamon, oregano, and candied orange peel. Unique and complex, yet easy and approachable.
From Genes. Decent lager, not a fruity as some kellerbiers, needed a little more oomph. Serving: Bottle

Cloudy yellow and orange, with little head. Tastes of citrus, hay, banana, spices, bubblegum and bitter hops. Medium body, aggressive carbonation and a finish of bubblegumy hay. A not very good substitute for pilsner

Bottle from ceveteca lisboa. Appearance is cloudy and dark gold to orange. Head is thin to medium and white. Light to medium sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body. Aroma is malty, hoppy, fruity.

BB 27.1.2017 Golden orange,slightly hazy, big lasting white head. Malty bread, cereal, grain, feint toffee, grassy and mild spice hops. Sweet and malty, bready and bitterness nicely balanced. Enjoyable and well made.

Bottle from SB 160423.
Pours a hazy golden with lacing white head. Malty, bready nose with some herbal notes. Some acidic spiciness in the palate. Rather refreshing.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Bready malty smell with some hay and in the background I got some light fruits. Similar taste. Light and refreshing. At the same time it is a bit mild and clean for a kellerbier.
(Bouteille provenant de Bottlecraft): Une belle rondeur légèrement fromagée et savonneuse avec une moelleuse vivacité herbacée. Se laisse boire sans les mains.

16 oz draft pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of bread, caramel and grass. Taste is yeast, grains and a little earthy.

On tap at Brewdog Camden. Didnt take very detailed notes but I enjoyed it -- more interesting than your average lager.

Caña en el deutschland 20..04..2016. Color ambar con espuma blanca aromas y sabores maltosos y cereales con toques frescos de amargos algo herbaceos y ligeramente florales con tonos suaves dulces. Cuerpo medio algo espumoso. Refrescante. Buena.

330 ml bottle into lager glass, bottled on 2/3/2016. Pours lightly hazy golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky white head with awesome retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of lemon, cracker, biscuit, light honey/toast, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Muted and a bit fruity in the nose. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of bready malt and earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of lemon, cracker, biscuit, light honey/toast, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of cracker, biscuit, light honey/toast, herbal, grass, and light pepper on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice robustness and balance of bready malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors with minimal yeast notes present. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly crisp, and creamy/bready/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice kellerbier style. All around great robustness and balance of bready malt and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth, crisp, and clean to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Local 44, Philadelphia tap: pours hazy golden orange with a white head. Aroma is vegetables, bread, and graas. Taste is bitter, malty, and very grassy. Easy to drink and what they atyle should be.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Aroma of malt. Clear dark amber color, white head that drops to a cover, lace cobwebs. Taste is pure malt that adds strong carbonation on the swallow, then assertive hops in a long finish. This is supposed to be a representation of the purity law; it succeeds.

Poured from 2 nice and cold 11.2 ounce bottles into a dimpled glass. Ya.
Zer Goot. Superb. Very smooth, easy and enjoyable to taste in mouth filled gulps, too.

Cobrizo limpio y espuma blanca abundante y jabonosa. Aromas de maltas dulces, ligero sulfuroso, herbáceo y floral. Cuerpo ligero y maltoso, con sabor de maltas, herbáceo y final de amargor seco medio.

Botella del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 14/04/2016
BBD:03/02/17 Color amarillo, transparente, sabor maltosa, dulce, final seco.

Bottle. Pour is hazy gold (almost light amber) with a smallish white head. Aroma is spicy and fruity up front with a light floral note and some biscuit malt. Flavor is also spicy and floral with a touch of floral hop in the finish. Lots of clean golden malt as well. Nicely balanced. Bold for the style.

Draught at Deep Ellum, 3/27/16.Softly hazy light-amber with some auburn hues mixed in. White head atop is small but fairly firm.The nose reveals quite little, actually. UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 Bottle. Slightly hazy golden color with big white head that is surprisingly stable. Aroma is sweet grainy, yeasty. Taste is sweet malty-grainy. Finish is slightly bitter, mouthfeel is slightly watery, but also quite oily. A nice Kellerbier.

Bottle. Deep gold with a large white head. Aroma - some bread, lemon, floral and slightly spicy hops. In the taste there is a little toastiness too Round and reasonably sweet with a firm bitter finish. I was all ready to declare "quality but a bit meek" even before I opened it, but this is pretty tasty as well as polished.
Bottle. Pours a mostly clear orangish color with white head. Earthy, straw, bread, yeasty aromas. Bread, yeasty, earthy, hay flavors. I had a sixer and its not bad, but nothing mind blowing.

Hay, minty grass accents, unmalted unroasted barley aroma. Clear amber, thick head, good lacing. Grainy and grassy, hearty. Noble hop finish. New plastic present. Medium body, easy carbonation. Not without flaws, but definitely what a lager should be with regard to fullness of flavor and body.
On tap at BrewDog Liverpool. Gold orange slightly haze lasting white head. lager yeast aroma. Plenty of lager character. Some kellerbier character. Some malt some hop.

On tap at In De Wilderman. Its a yellow beer with a white head. It a very nice clean hoppy and grainy malty. Nice grainy and hoppy flavor. Smooth and clean.

Tap at In de Wildeman. Slight hazy golden with white head. Light bread and dough, bakers yeast, light grassy, some dust, paper, green leaves. Light sweet and bitter. Under medium bodied with creamy feel. Decent stuff!

medium white head. Hazy golden pour. Refreshing but nothing special
